kiwi.ui
Class StateIndicator

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLabel
                  kiwi.ui.StateIndicator
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class StateIndicator
extends javax.swing.JLabel

A graphical state indicator component. This component displays one of a collection of images, depending on what its current "state" is. Each state is indicated by a unique string; the component maintains a mapping of these strings to the corresponding state icons.

This component can be used to create status icons and other types of multi-state indicators.

Since:
Kiwi 1.4.3
Author:
Mark Lindner
See Also:
ToggleIndicator, Serialized Form

Method Detail

clearStates

public void clearStates()
Remove all states from the indicator.

addState

public void addState(java.lang.String state,
                     javax.swing.Icon icon)
Add a new state to the indicator.

Parameters:
state - The name of the state.
icon - The icon to display for this state.

removeState

public void removeState(java.lang.String state)
Remove a state from the indicator.

Parameters:
state - The name of the state.

setState

public void setState(java.lang.String state)
Set the state of the indicator.

Parameters:
state - The new state for the indicator. The indicator will be repainted immediately. If the specified state is invalid, the state will be set to null and the icon to default icon.

getState

public java.lang.String getState()
Get the current state of the indicator.

Returns:
The current state of the indicator, which may be null.
